    • Method Detail

      • getSpacing

        public static float getSpacing()
        Returns:
        The current spacing being used.

      • getDefaultFontSize

        public static int getDefaultFontSize()
        Returns the current font size used for printing the notes.

      • setSpacing

        public static void setSpacing(float spacing)
        Used for setting the spacing between the notes. The spacing has a maximum setting of 80 since anything more than that would not allow a measure to have 5 spaces between vertical bars.

      • setDefaultFontSize

        public static void setDefaultFontSize(int defaultFontSize)
        Sets the font size to be used for printing notes. The default is 8.
        Parameters:
        defaultFontSize -

      • createTab

        public static void createTab(com.itextpdf.text.Document document,
             com.itextpdf.text.pdf.PdfContentByte contentByte,
             java.lang.String body)
                      throws com.itextpdf.text.DocumentException,
                             java.io.IOException
        The method which is called to produce a new PDF tablature. It calls all the methods necessary to create a new PDF. It should only be called when creating a new PDF and not when modifying an exiting one for performance reasons.
        Parameters:
        document - A reference to the iText pdf document.
        contentByte - The canvas which is being drawn to.
        body - The tablature of notes, measures, staves and musical symbols.
        Throws:
        com.itextpdf.text.DocumentException
        java.io.IOException

      • drawTablature

        public static void drawTablature()
                          throws com.itextpdf.text.DocumentException,
                                 java.io.IOException
        drawTablature is responsible for drawing the actual PDF It is called the first time a PDF is created and for all subsequent modifications to the PDF. It has the precondition that the staves have already been concatenated into one large stave to be partitioned into smaller staves which will fit within the width of the page.
        Throws:
        com.itextpdf.text.DocumentException
        java.io.IOException

      • drawTripleThinBars

        private static void drawTripleThinBars(float xPosTok,
                      int yPos)
        Draws three vertical bars.
        Parameters:
        xPosTok - The position of the first bar relative to the last character in the token, multiplied by the line spacing.
        yPos - The vertical position of the bar.

      • curveAndLetter

        private static void curveAndLetter(java.lang.String token,
                  float yTune,
                  int xPos,
                  int yPos,
                  int fontWidth,
                  java.lang.String letter)
        Parameters:
        token - The token to be parsed, in version 1.0 this is 5 character long.
        yTune - Used to tune the vertical position relative to the original y position.
        xPos - The horizontal position of the symbol to be drawn.
        yPos - The original vertical position of the symbol to be drawn.
        fontWidth - The width of the character. Not exactly the actually width, there are no units associated with this number currently. It is for tweaking the position where the bar line stops being drawn, and then starts being drawn again after the symbol is drawn.

      • drawPullOff

        private static void drawPullOff(java.lang.String token,
               float yTune,
               int xPos,
               int yPos,
               int fontWidth,
               java.lang.String letter)
        Parameters:
        token - The token to be parsed, in version 1.0 this is 5 character long.
        yTune - Used to tune the vertical position relative to the original y position.
        xPos - The horizontal position of the symbol to be drawn.
        yPos - The original vertical position of the symbol to be drawn.
        fontWidth - The width of the character. Not exactly the actually width, there are no units associated with this number currently. It is for tweaking the position where the bar line stops being drawn, and then starts being drawn again after the symbol is drawn.

      • calcPosRelToEnd

        private static float calcPosRelToEnd(int posFromEnd,
                    int xPos)
        Finds the position relative to the last character of a token, taking line spacing into account.
        Parameters:
        posFromEnd - The number of characters between the last character and the character whose position we want to find.
        xPos - The position of the last character of the token.
        Returns:
        The horizontal position of the character whose position relative to the end of the token is scaled by the spacing for document.

      • drawLeftMargin

        private static void drawLeftMargin(int xPos,
                  int yPos)
        Draws the left margin of the document. Has the precondition that the x Position argument is equal to the margin width.
        Parameters:
        xPos - The current horizontal position of the pencil.
        yPos - The current vertical position of the pencil.

      • drawLagatoSlide

        private static void drawLagatoSlide(java.lang.String token,
                   float yTune,
                   float xPosTok,
                   int yPos,
                   int fontWidth)
        Draw the lagato slide, which is a digit followed by a slash through the barline, followed by another digit.
        Parameters:
        token - The 5 character token (as of version 1.0)
        yTune - Tweaks the vertical position with which the symbols are drawn.
        xPosTok - The position relative to the end of the token
        yPos - The y position of the pencil
        fontWidth - The width of the character. Not exactly the actually width, there are no units associated with this number currently. It is for tweaking the position where the bar line stops being drawn, and then starts being drawn again after the symbol is drawn.

      • drawSlash

        private static void drawSlash(float xPosTok,
             int yPos)
        Helper method for the legato slide methods. It draws the slash which goes through the barline.
        Parameters:
        xPosTok - The position of th eslash relative to the end of the token.
        yPos - The vertical position of the pencil.

      • drawDiamond

        private static void drawDiamond(float xPosTok,
               int yPos,
               float diamondSpace,
               float diamondWidth)
        Draws the diamond shape for volume swells.
        Parameters:
        xPosTok - The position of the diamond relative to the end of the token.
        yPos - The vertical position of the pencil.
        diamondSpace - the length of the line between the digit to be drawn and the left edge of the the diamond to be drawn. Increasing this value moves the diamond to the right, while decreasin it moves the diamond closer to the left.
        diamondWidth - The length of the diamond going to the left side to the right side it is unit-less and is meant for tweaking the overall size of the diamond.

      • singleDigitLineSurround

        private static void singleDigitLineSurround(float xPosTok,
                           int yPos,
                           int fontWidth)

      • drawText

        private static void drawText(float yTune,
            float xPos,
            int yPos,
            java.lang.String text,
            int fontSize)
        Draws text to the specified position.
        Parameters:
        yTune - For fine tuning the vertical position of the text relative to the pencil coordinates
        xPos - The pencils current horizontal coordinates
        yPos - The pencils current vertical coordinates
        text - The text to be written
        fontSize - The desired font size. Default is 8

      • twoDigitLineSurround

        private static void twoDigitLineSurround(float xPosTok,
                        int yPos,
                        int fontWidth)
        Used for drawing barlines around double digits.
        Parameters:
        xPosTok - The position of the first digit relative to the second one.
        yPos - The vertical position of the pencil.
        fontWidth - The width of the character. Not exactly the actually width, there are no units associated with this number currently. It is for tweaking the position where the bar line stops being drawn, and then starts being drawn again after the symbol is drawn.

      • drawCircles

        public static void drawCircles(float xPos,
               float y,
               float offset)
        Draws dots at the specified x and y coordinates.
        Parameters:
        offset - The offset moves the dots to the right for positive values and to the left for negative values.
        xPos - the x position of the pencil.
        y - the y position of the pencil.

      • drawBeginRepeatSymbol

        public static void drawBeginRepeatSymbol(float x,
                         float y,
                         int side)
        Draws a thick vertical bar at the given x and y position.
        Parameters:
        side - specifies whether it is a begin or end repeat symbol, 0 means begin and 1 means end.

      • drawThickVertBar

        private static void drawThickVertBar(float x,
                    float y)
        Draws a thick vertical bar at the specified x and y coordinates.
        Parameters:
        x - is horizontal position
        y - is the vertical position of the third bar.

      • drawThinVertBar

        private static void drawThinVertBar(float x,
                   float y)
        Draws a thin vertcal bar at the specified coordinates.
        Parameters:
        x - is horizontal position of the bar.
        y - is the vertical position of the third bar.

      • getBigStave

        public static java.lang.String[] getBigStave()
        Returns the big stave. Precondition: The big stave has been created successfully.

      • makeBigStave

        public static boolean makeBigStave(java.lang.String body)
        Makes one big stave with all measures on it.
        Parameters:
        body - all staves, measures and digits.

      • seperateStaves

        public static java.lang.String[] seperateStaves(java.lang.String s)
        Separates all the staves into seperate strings.
        Parameters:
        s - The whole body which contains all staves, measures and symbols. Precondition: All staves are separated by two or more consecutive new line characters. Post: Returns an array of Strings where each array is a stave.

      • removeConsecutiveBars

        public static java.lang.String[] removeConsecutiveBars(java.lang.String[] staves)
        Takes a array of staves and removes consecutive vertical bars, so that the big stave is a valid musical stave. For example: |-----|----|----|-----| instead of... |-----|----||----|-----| when after conctenating staves together.

      • getOrganizedStaves

        public static java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String[]> getOrganizedStaves()
        Returns:
        The list of staves partitioned in way that they will fit on the page.

      • concatStaves

        public static java.lang.String[] concatStaves(java.lang.String[] staves)
        Concatenates all the staves into one long stave, which is returned as an array strings, each string is a separate line of the stave.

      • reorganizeStaves

        public static boolean reorganizeStaves()
        Takes the big Stave and partitions it into 1 or more staves such that each stave contains the maximum number of measures, while each stave remains with the boundary of the body width. Preconditon: The big stave must be initialized, - the first measure has no more than 3 vertical bars at the start.

      • makeLastStave

        private static void makeLastStave(int lastIndex,
                 int i)
        If end of the big stave has been reached but the current set of measures is still in bounds then make a new stave containing all remaining measures.

      • indexOfLastMeasure

        public static int indexOfLastMeasure(int lastBarLastMeas,
                     int firstBarCurMeas)
        Returns the index of the previous measure. If no previous measure is found or the current measure is to large to fit within bounds then -1 is returned. More specifically returns the index of the last vertical bar at the end of the preceding measure.
        Parameters:
        firstBarCurMeas - The current index of the bigStave, (should be the first vertical bar of the current measure.
        lastBarLastMeas - The index of the last vertical bar of the preceding measure.

      • isInBounds

        public static boolean isInBounds(int lastIndex,
                 int curIndex)
        Checks to see if the space between the two indices is within the bounds of the page.
        Parameters:
        lastIndex - The index of the last vertical bar of the last measure, or in the case of being start of the song, the vertical bar at the begging of the song.
        curIndex - The first vertical bar of the current measure.
        Returns:
        True if the space between the two indices is less than desired width of the body. False otherwise.

      • cutStave

        public static void cutStave(int lastIndex,
            int curIndex)
        Copies a partition of the big stave into a a stave buffer, to be copied into the final list of organized staves.
        Parameters:
        lastIndex - The beginning index where the cut starts.
        curIndex - The last part where the cut ends. Pre-condition: bigStave must be initialized, lastindex must be less than curindex and both must be natural numbers. Post: Sets the staveBuffer to a copy of the partition between the start and end indices.

      • getRepeatNum

        public static int getRepeatNum(java.lang.String line1,
               java.lang.String line2)
        Returns:
        The repeat number embedded in in double vertical bars, if no number is embedded then returns -1. for example: |2 || || || will return 2. || || || || will return -1

      • countEndBars

        public static int countEndBars(java.lang.String line)
        Counts the number of consecutive vertical bars counting backwards from the end of the last line. Pre-condition: All vertical bars are located within the last 5 indices of the line and all measures have a length greater than 5.
        Returns:
        Returns the number of ending vertical bars.

      • countBeginBars

        public static int countBeginBars(java.lang.String line)
        Counts the number of consecutive vertical bars counting from the start of the first line. Pre-conditions: All vertical bars are located within the first 5 indices of the line. All measure have a length greater than 5.
        Returns:
        the number of vertical bars at the start of the first line.

      • buildStave

        private static java.lang.String buildStave(java.lang.String[] lines)
        Takes an array of lines and builds a stave from it. Pre-condition: All lines are the same length.

      • splitLines

        private static java.lang.String[] splitLines(java.lang.String stave)
        Splits a stave into separate lines. Pre-condition: Each line is ended with \n Post: An array of lines for the given stave.

      • getLine

        public static java.lang.String getLine(int i,
                       java.lang.String s)
        Returns the i'th line of the given string where 0 is the first line. If there there is no i'th line null is returned.
        Parameters:
        i - The line to be removed.
        s - A string of lines.

      • countLines

        public static int countLines(java.lang.String s)
        Counts the number of lines in the string.
        Parameters:
        s - The string with lines in it.
        Returns:
        The number of lines within the string.

      • drawHeader

        public static boolean drawHeader(com.itextpdf.text.pdf.PdfContentByte canvas,
                 java.lang.String[] header)
                          throws com.itextpdf.text.DocumentException,
                                 java.io.IOException
        Draws a stylish header.
        Parameters:
        canvas - Used to draw objects to the PDF.
        header - A array of strings the, first being the title of the song and the second being the composer.
        Throws:
        com.itextpdf.text.DocumentException
        java.io.IOException
